TEXT: The applicants are NORP nationals ; their names , year of birth and places of residence are set out in the annex . The first applicant is a secondary school teacher and also a member of the directive board of an independent trade union open to employees of public schools , called “ School basic committees ” ( GPE della Scuola - hereinafter referred to as “ Cobas”).The other applicants are secondary school teachers who are also members of the said trade union .
The applicants are all represented by Mr. PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , ORG .
The facts of the present case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE a decree was issued by ORG which set out , pursuant to LAW paragraph LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , the trade ORG which were considered under LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , to be the “ most representative ” ( sindacati maggiormente rappresentativi ) of the school compartment and were accordingly admitted to take part in the collective bargaining . PERSON was not amongst these trade unions .

On DATE the CARDINAL most representative trade unions and ORG for the representation of public administrations in negotiations ( see below ) entered into a collective labour agreement ( contratto collettivo ) on terms of employment and work conditions of public school teachers .

ORG , which , as well as other excluded trade unions , disagreed with the content of the collective agreement , embarked on a number of protest actions such as demonstration , strikes and occupations of schools . They also organised an informal referendum , whereby the majority expressed its discontent with the adopted agreement .
Subsequent to these events , on DATE a new collective agreement was concluded , which included certain amendments urged by the dissenting trade unions .

On DATE ORG endorsed the collective agreement , which thus acquired legal force erga omnes , i.e. in respect of all employees of the compartment , including those whose trade unions were not admitted to the collective bargaining .

Framework Law on Civil Servants no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ( legge quadro sul pubblico impiego n. CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , hereinafter referred to as “ the Law ” , divided civil servants into CARDINAL categories called “ compartments ” . Each compartment was regulated by its own “ compartment collective agreement ” ( contratto collettivo compartimentale ) .
Section CARDINAL of the LAW regulated the system of collective bargaining . The procedure can be summarised as follows .

DATE prior to the expiry of the collective agreement , negotiations were opened between , on the Government ’s side , a governmental delegation set up for each compartment and , on the employees’ side , the most representative trade unions on the national level . Certain other trade unions ( the most representative on the compartment level ) could be allowed to participate , whereas single employees were excluded from the negotiations .

Once an agreement was reached , within DATE ORG would have , after verifying whether the agreement is in accordance with the relevant legislation and with the estimated budget for DATE , to endorse the agreement , which would then be signed by the parties . Within DATE from the date of the signature , the collective agreement would have to be enacted in the form of a Decree issued by the President of the Republic , after approval by ORG . LAW was to be endorsed by ORG ( however , in practice , ORG carried out this task prior to the verification by ORG ) . At this stage the agreement would be valid erga omnes . The collective agreement , in the form of LAW , would be published in ORG and enter into force on DATE after its publication . It would be valid for DATE from its entry into force .

LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE set out the criteria for determining the degree of representation of the trade unions in each compartment . These criteria were : a ) the percentage of proxies for paying contributions which the trade union is given by the workers ( consistenza associativa ) ; b ) the percentage of votes obtained in the elections of different administrative organs ; c ) the presence and importance of the trade union ’s bodies in the compartment .

Law Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE assimilated civil servants ( including employees in public schools ) to private employees , thus making ordinary labour law applicable to their employment contracts . Framework collective compartment agreements are to be entered into ; an ORG for the representation of public administrations in negotiations ( GPE per la rappresentanza negoziale delle pubbliche amministrazioni - ARAN ) was created and placed under the supervision of the Presidency of ORG .

Under LAW , the degree of representation of trade unions was to be determined in an agreement between the President of ORG and the trade unions . The relevant Presidential Decree could be appealed to the administrative courts by those trade unions which were considered not to be representative enough , through an expedited procedure . Article CARDINAL was abrogated by Presidential decree No . CARDINAL of DATE .

Decree CARDINAL/CARDINAL introduced new criteria for determining the real degree of representation of workers in trade unions with a view to selecting the trade unions to be admitted to the collective bargaining . Pursuant to the new LAW CARDINAL/CARDINAL , workers must be represented by trade unions whose degree of representation in the relevant compartment is PERCENT , which percentage is calculated on the basis of the average between the percentage of proxies for paying contributions the trade union was given by the workers ( dato associativo ) and the percentage of votes it obtained in the personnel elections ( dato elettorale ) .

The new procedure for negotiating collective agreements is as follows . Before commencing the collective bargaining , instructions ( atti d’indirizzo ) are issued by ORG ( comitati di settore ) of ORG . Negotiations are then carried out by the trade unions and the ARAN . Once a draft agreement has been reached , the ORG submits it to ORG of the relevant compartment , which , within DATE , has to express its opinion thereon . Upon the ORG ’s favourable opinion , DATE ORG submits the calculation of the prospective costs to ORG which , within DATE , must certify its compatibility with the budget . In case ORG does not issue its decision within the said time - limit , its approval is considered as given .

Upon ORG explicit or implicit approval , the President of ORG signs the agreement , which acquires legal force erga omnes , i.e. in respect of all employees of the compartment , including those whose trade unions were not admitted to the collective bargaining .
Upon ORG negative decision , ORG must try , if possible , to reduce the prospective costs , otherwise the negotiations are reopened .

The collective agreement can be challenged before the administrative courts by the trade unions which participated in the negotiations to the extent that it does not correspond to what had been agreed upon . It can also be challenged by the dissenting trade unions insofar as their dissenting opinions have not been taken into consideration .
Each employee can appeal to the regional administrative courts against any decision directly affecting him / her , which is taken in the enforcement of the collective agreement .
